items.title: nixos/borgbackup: add package option

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Successor of #258189 which I messed up with force push (yt).

Add the keyboards.<name>.extraConfig option, which allows you to create more complex configurations. Especially useful when you need to use composite layers. Ideally, the order of set attributes needs be preserved, which is currently impossible with nix.

Resolves #258083

As @jian-lin suggested, I got rid of IFD and changed types.str to types.lines. Also, the difference from the previous pr is that I changed the test a bit to handle the extraConfig option.
I decided not to add myself to the maintainers-list because I probably won't have time to play with nixpkgs until next year.

items.content_html:
Description of changes

refactor the quassel service to allow full declarative configuration and add new configuration options.

Database and Authentication settings can now be set declarative when the configFromEnvironment variable is set to true. This defaults to false as to prevent breaking existing configuration.

Also moved all quassel settings options into the settings block and rename and organize them according to quassels flag naming.

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This option wraps the sway binary to allow it to request realtime scheduling (SCHED_RR). This allow for possible lower latency, specially when the system is under high load.

Available since Sway 1.8. See:

  • swaywm/sway#6994
  • https://github.com/swaywm/sway/releases/tag/1.8

items.title: nixos/sway: add enableRealtime option

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Add a convenient option to install Dolphin in other desktop environment. In my case that's Hyprland and (previously) Sway.

When only the dolphin package is installed, it has broken theme, and hamburger button->Show Panels->Terminal will tell you it actually needs konsole package despite there is nothing in the UI to show this feature is broken. It is subpar compared to how dolphin is presented in a normal KDE install, and makes adapting it in other desktop environment difficult, since there is no documentation for it.

The included options are picked from my personal nixos-config, and is tested with this patch:

dolphin.patch.zip

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Provide a NixOS module for the built-in Anki Sync Server included in recent versions of Anki. This supersedes the ankisyncd module, but we should keep that for now because ankisyncd supports older versions of Anki clients than this module.

Description of changes

services.xserver.xkbLayout does not really work in GNOME, which is a common source of confusion for newcomers (latest instance).
Let’s add an option inspired by console.useXkbConfig reflecting the X server options in GNOME settings.

cc @linsui, @bobby285271

items.title: {,nixos/}rkvm: init

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Instead of iterating over all replacements and applying them one by one, use the newly introduced replaceDependencies function to apply them all at once for replaceRuntimeDependencies. The advantages are twofold in case there are multiple replacements:

  • Performance is significantly improved, because there is only one pass over the closure to be made.
  • Correctness is improved, because replaceDependencies also replaces dependencies of the replacements themselves if applicable.

Fixes: #4336

items.title: nixos-manual with mmdoc

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This PR adds a option to make the files in the home recursively owned by the actual user/group this can be useful in cases where you have files in the home directory before the user exits. A example use case is described in nix-community/disko#383 where otherwise files end up getting owned by the root user.

items.title: nixos/users-groups: add recursiveCreateHome

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Add nixos-rebuild repl, which loads a nix repl for you.

If you use flakes, brings the flake itself into scope as well.

Apologies to the non-flake users; your repl isn't quite as fancy, but at least evaluates your config exactly as you would expect, unlike flakes which are only evaluated impurely for now.

Tested by hand, as evaluating in the sandbox is tricky.

Try it

Flake in ~/config

nix run github:hercules-ci/nixpkgs/nixos-rebuild-repl#nixos-rebuild -- repl --flake ~/config

Non-flake

nix --extra-experimental-features flakes\ nix-command run github:hercules-ci/nixpkgs/nixos-rebuild-repl#nixos-rebuild -- repl

items.content_html:
Description of changes

i've been using ssh certificates lately and it would be super convenient if i could add principals via users.users.foo.authorizedPrincipals = [ "value" ]; instead of environment.etc."sshd/authorized_principals.d/foo".text = "value"; as the former is type checked and not susceptible to path typos

on an unrelated note: @teto do you know if openssh accepts a , as a separator for AuthorizedKeysFile? if not what is our plan to migrate services.openssh.authorizedKeysFiles to services.openssh.settings.AuthorizedKeysFile? i would like us to proceed with this and am willing to do the work

    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 23.11 Release Notes (or backporting 23.05 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.
items.title: nixos/openssh: add support for authorized principals
